instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
fn main() { let mut name = String::from("hello"); let r1 = &mut name; let r2 = &mut name; r1.push_str(" "); r2.push_str("world"); }
```

## Compiler Error:
cannot borrow `name` as mutable more than once at a time

## Fixed Code:
output: fn main() { let mut name = String::from("hello"); { let r1 = &mut name; r1.push_str(" "); } let r2 = &mut name; r2.push_str("world"); }

instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
struct User { data: Vec<i32> } fn main() { let mut s = User { data: vec![1] }; let r1 = &mut s.data; let r2 = &mut s.data; r1.push(2); r2.push(3); }
```

## Compiler Error:
cannot borrow `s.data` as mutable more than once at a time

## Fixed Code:
output: struct User { data: Vec<i32> } fn main() { let mut s = User { data: vec![1] }; s.data.push(2); s.data.push(3); }
